title: Adaptive Weighing Designs for Keyword Value Computation

author: Georgios Zervas, Department of Computer Science, Boston University

segmentation: So good afternoon, my name is Yoko service and I will present work that we conducted with my two advisors, John Byers and Mike meeting markers on adaptive wing designs for keyword value computation.
Part of this work was done at Adver Plex Inc. Startup in Cambridge, MA that specializes in.
Online advertising so I would like to start by precisely defining what the keyword, VC's and it's a very simple measure.
It's the total keyword revenue over the number of clicks we received on a specific keyword.
VPC is a foundational quantity in online advertising, and it's used by online advertisers to calibrate keyword bids.
These guys want to get their bids as accurate as possible.
The reason is that this is a highly competitive environment and a small VPC error can make or break a campaign.
So we're interested in calculating keyword VC's in the channelization setting, which I'm going to introduce now.
So consider a user that visits a search engine such as Google or Yahoo or Bing and performs a query for fax machines.

Among other things, he's presented with a set of sponsored ads on the right hand side, and he proceeds to click on an ad and, you know, he's directed to the website of the advertiser who plays that add the advertiser is charged for the click and the keyword goes and the user goes to the website.

The advertiser then proceeds to use all that all these reports to calculate keyword to excuse me to compute keyword VCs and accordingly update his keyword.

What is unique about our setting is that there is an abundance of keywords you can think of thousands or even hundreds of thousands of keywords and a scarcity of channels, usually in the range of hundreds.
That means that the keyword that the advertiser has to bundle many keywords within one channel, and in particular the revenue of many keywords has to be bundled within one channel.

So what is the problem facing the advertiser?
Well, his goal is to obtain very accurate VC estimates for every single keyword in his advertising campaign.
What he knows is the clicks per keyword for individual keywords and the revenue per channel.
What he doesn't know is the individual keyword VCs and he wants to learn this in a setting that usually involves many keywords and few channels.
So now I should point out that channels were never intended for this exact purpose, and you know companies like Add replex, hire smart people to abuse them in.
Interesting ways.
And I'll show you some of these ways.
But before continuing, I should point out that keywords are not fixed to a channel.
So if you select the channel for a keyword on day one then you can remap it on day two and that will be key to our salute.
So at the very high level, what it boils down to is disaggregating aggregate data.
We have aggregate channel VCs and we want to get individual keyword VCs out of them.
And regression methods are well established technique for doing just that.
However, our setting is slightly unique, so keywords there is a lot of securing our environment both in terms of the PC's and the actual traffic that keywords receive also.
There is error in our measurements and the error is not associated with the actual channel, but the actual keyword.

We exploit adaptivity to arrange our measurements intelligently, overtime, and speed up the convergence of VPC estimation.

Very few of them, and he wanted to reduce the error in estimating these weights.

This is different from our setting.
